definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
to shed tears of gratitude (idiom); moved to tears

sentences.english: Your condescension, as always, is much appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 像往常一樣，你的屈尊俯就總是讓人感激。

sentences.english: The story speaks of more than thankfulness.
sentences.chinese: 這故事講述的不僅僅是感激之情。

sentences.english: Figueres thanked the crowd for their enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 費格雷斯對羣衆的熱情表示感激。

sentences.english: Your note of congratulations is deeply appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 你的賀信使我非常感激。

sentences.english: And to show my appreciation, I would like to pay for your first face-lift.
sentences.chinese: 爲了表達我的感激，我願意花錢請你做一次整容。

sentences.english: One day is hardly enough to show our gratitude。
sentences.chinese: 僅這一天遠不足以表達我們對您的感激之情。

sentences.english: Woods never liked the black widow this is gratitude toward her smiling.
sentences.chinese: 嗚茲從來都不喜歡黑寡婦，這次卻感激地朝着她笑了。

sentences.english: Every night before bed, she thinks of five things she’s grateful for.
sentences.chinese: 每天晚上睡覺前，她都要想五件讓自己感激的事情。

sentences.english: The thankful Pilgrims included the Indians in their harvest celebration.
sentences.chinese: 心存感激的新移民在慶豐收時也邀請了印第安人蔘加。

sentences.english: She told Charlie, "I'm grateful for how pretty that vase is."
sentences.chinese: 她對查理說，“這個花瓶太美麗了，我很感激。”

sentences.english: I will be very grateful if you grant my leave.
sentences.chinese: 如果您能准假我會非常感激。

sentences.english: I am very grateful to them. Thinking of them as confidants .
sentences.chinese: 我非常感激他們倆，感謝他們成爲我的知己。

sentences.english: But we should be grateful to this Carmarthen courthouse campaign.
sentences.chinese: 但我們應當對喀麥登法院的這一活動心存感激。

sentences.english: And most of their parents don't care; but some of the kids do.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的家長不以爲意，但有些學生心存感激。

sentences.english: We thank you for your consideration in making us the consignment of 30 bales of cotton goods.
sentences.chinese: 貴方欲委託敝公司銷售棉織品30包，我方不勝感激。

definition: to feel guilty/to feel ashamed of oneself/to be remorseful
to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
guilty conscience/to feel a twinge of guilt
to shed tears of gratitude (idiom); moved to tears
